alert.note: Alert for Haleakala Summit; Kipahulu; Maui Central Valley North; Maui Central Valley South; Maui Leeward West; South Haleakala; South Maui, Upcountry (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 16 at 5:26PM HST until January 17 at 12:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH FOR MAUI THROUGH TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...The island of Maui in Maui County. * WHEN...Until 4 AM HST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Flood prone roads and other low lying areas may be closed due to elevated runoff and overflowing streams. Urban areas may receive more significant flooding and property damage due to rapid runoff. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A band of moderate to heavy showers has become stationary over eastern portions of Leeward Maui. This band is expected to remain over the area through much of the night and will bring an increased risk of flash flooding, especially to the leeward slopes of Mount Haleakala and locations in the vicinity of Kihei and Wailea.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
